excerpt: Bustling district known for its narrow streets, food stalls & sweeping views of the mountains & sea.
detail_description: Jiufen Old Street is a lively area with narrow streets, food stalls, and stunning views of the mountains and sea. The Flip Flop Hostel offers various types of accommodation in well-preserved old buildings at reasonable prices. The staff are dedicated to helping visitors explore the authentic Jiufen, focusing on the stories of long-term residents and local artists.
name: Jiufen Old Street
address: Jishan St, Ruifang District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 224

excerpt: At 40 m. wide, this well-known cascade waterfall in scenic surrounds is the broadest in Taiwan.
detail_description: Shifen Waterfall is a famous cascade in Taiwan, known for being the broadest at 40 meters wide. It is often referred to as 'Taiwan's Niagara Falls.' Visitors can explore the area around the waterfall, including Shifen Old Street and Pingxi, where they can release lanterns. The journey to the waterfall may involve passing through scenic areas like Xinliao and encountering interesting plants and fruits along with a small pagoda surrounded by pomelo trees.
name: Shifen Waterfall
address: No. 10乾坑 Pingxi District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 226

excerpt: Roadside waterfall flowing over rust-colored rocks & soil due to minerals from a former mining area.
detail_description: Golden Waterfall is a unique and picturesque roadside attraction located near the Gold Ecological Park in Jinguashi, just a short distance from the former mining area. The waterfall's striking golden color comes from the minerals deposited in the riverbed, creating a beautiful contrast with the lush green surroundings. This cascade appears to glow with a yellow hue due to its high mineral content, including sulfur, arsenic, and copper ore flowing down from the mountain above.
name: Golden Waterfall
address: Jinshui Rd, Ruifang District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 224

excerpt: Bustling, open-air market with many stalls serving Taiwanese street food, unique snacks & sweets.
detail_description: Keelung MiaoKou Night Market is a lively open-air market filled with stalls offering a wide variety of Taiwanese street food, unique snacks, and delectable sweets. The market's name originates from the incense of the temple in Dienji Palace, which attracted numerous pilgrims in its early days. Visitors can savor popular dishes such as Dingbian file sandwich, bubble ice cream, and flavorful crabs. Additionally, nutritious sandwiches are also a must-try at this bustling market.
name: Keelung MiaoKou Night Market
address: 玉田里仁三路 Ren’ai District, Keelung City, Taiwan 200

excerpt: Ruifang District is a suburban district in eastern New Taipei City, Taiwan. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Ruifang District, located in eastern New Taipei City, Taiwan, is home to the former mining towns of Shuinandong, Jinguashi, and Jiufen. Each town offers a unique glimpse into Taiwan's mining history and culture. While Shuinandong exudes a simple charm, Jinguashi boasts tranquility and Jiufen showcases traces of miners' nightlife. Although the gold mines are no longer operational, these towns continue to captivate visitors with their allure.
name: Ruifang District
address: New Taipei City, Taiwan 224

excerpt: Railroad tracks run through this old street with shops & restaurants, plus sky-lantern lightings.
detail_description: Shifen Old Street is a charming destination that beautifully blends culture and nature, making it a must-visit spot in Taiwan. This historic street features vibrant shops and delightful restaurants lining the railroad tracks, creating an inviting atmosphere for visitors. One of the highlights here is the enchanting sky-lantern lighting experience, where you can release your own lantern into the sky—a tradition that symbolizes wishes and hopes.
name: Shifen Old Street
address: No. 81號, Shifen St, Pingxi District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 226

detail_description: Jiufen Teahouse, located in the historic mountain town of Jiufen, Taiwan, is a renowned attraction offering a picturesque setting and traditional tea culture. The charming teahouse provides visitors with a unique tea experience while enjoying breathtaking views of the surrounding mountains and ocean. It is one of several Japanese-inspired traditional teahouses in the area, including the iconic A-MEI Tea House.
name: Jiufen Teahouse
address: No. 142號, Jishan St, Ruifang District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 22448

excerpt: Open-air museum on gold-mining culture, plus the historic chalet of Crown Prince Hirohito.
detail_description: The Gold Museum, New Taipei City Government is an open-air museum that showcases the rich gold-mining culture and features the historic chalet of Crown Prince Hirohito. The museum houses a diverse collection of pre-Columbian gold and other metal composites, including Tumbaga, making it home to the world's largest accumulation of gold. Additionally, visitors can explore archaeological artifacts made from various materials such as earthenware, stone, shell, wood, and fabric.
name: Gold Museum, New Taipei City Government
address: No. 8號, Jinguang Rd, Ruifang District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 224

excerpt: Iconic tea house in a former blacksmith shop, with tea ceremonies & terrace views.
detail_description: Nestled in a charming former blacksmith shop, A-Mei Teahouse is an iconic destination that beautifully marries traditional Japanese architecture with stunning views. Adorned with vibrant red lanterns and a striking signboard, this teahouse has even inspired renowned filmmaker Hayao Miyazaki in his creation of 'Spirited Away.' Visitors flock here not only for the exquisite tea ceremonies but also to soak in breathtaking sunset vistas from its terrace.
name: A-Mei Teahouse
address: No. 20市下巷 Ruifang District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 224

excerpt: Legendary town for its historic gold & copper mines & as a World War II prisoner-of-war camp.
detail_description: Jinguashih, along with Shuinandong and Jiufen, are former mining towns in New Taipei City that offer a glimpse into Taiwan's rich mining history. Jinguashih is known for its tranquility and historic gold and copper mines, while the other towns each have their own unique charm. Although the gold mines are no longer operational, these towns continue to attract visitors who are drawn to their historical significance.
name: Jinguashih
address: Ruifang District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 224

excerpt: Rock scrambling skills are required to ascend this trail with far reaching views out to sea.
detail_description: Teapot Mountain Trail is a popular and adventurous hike located in Jinguashi, offering stunning views of the surrounding hills and sea. The trail requires rock scrambling skills as it ascends to the black, rocky summit that resembles a teapot from certain angles. Ropes are available to navigate around the teapot, with one route even passing through a rocky cave. While challenging in some areas, the trail provides an excellent beauty-to-difficulty ratio and should not be missed.
name: Teapot Mountain Trail
address: Ruifang District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 224

excerpt: Restored to reflect its 1930s heyday & open for tours, this theater occasionally shows old movies.
detail_description: Nestled in the charming mountain town of Jiufen, Taiwan, Shengping Theater is a captivating attraction that offers visitors a glimpse into the region's rich cultural and historical heritage. Originally constructed in the 1910s during the Japanese occupation, this beautifully restored theater stands as a testament to Taiwan's vibrant past.
name: Shengping Theater
address: No. 137, Qingbian Rd, Ruifang District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 224

excerpt: Once known for its prosperous coal mine, Houtong Cat Village is now famed for an abundance of cats, said to be 200 times that of the town’s current human population. Bordering both sides of the lush Keelung River, the area is home to the Houtong Shrine Relics, scenic viewpoints, and a museum. A mine cart ride is a highlight of Houtong Mine Leisure Park, while casual cafes and souvenir shops sell everything feline.
detail_description: Houtong Cat Village, once a thriving coal mining town, is now famous for its large population of cats, which reportedly outnumbers the human residents. Situated along the picturesque Keelung River, visitors can explore the Houtong Shrine Relics and enjoy scenic viewpoints. The Houtong Mine Leisure Park offers a thrilling mine cart ride experience. Additionally, the area features charming cafes and souvenir shops with cat-themed items.
name: Houtong Cat Village
address: Ruifang District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 224

excerpt: Roadside attraction featuring rock formations framing a unique blue- & yellow-colored bay.
detail_description: Yinyang Sea is a popular roadside attraction near Shuinan Cave, featuring unique rock formations that frame a bay with striking blue and yellow colors. The area offers stunning views of nearby attractions like Jiufen, Jinguashi Gold Museum, Keeluang Mountain, Yehliu Geopark, and Keelung Islet.
name: Yinyang Sea
address: 濓新里 Ruifang District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 224

detail_description: Ruifang Food Court is a must-visit spot in the scenic town of Ruifang, serving as a great base for exploring Northeast Taiwan's attractions. The food court offers a variety of local delicacies from different food stalls, making it an ideal place to sample authentic Taiwanese cuisine. It's conveniently located within walking distance from the Ruifang train station, making it easily accessible for visitors.
name: Ruifang Food Court
address: No. 2, Lane 35, Minsheng St, Ruifang District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 224

detail_description: Jinguashih, also known as Gold Ecological Park, is a former mining town located on the Northeast Coast to the east of Taipei. The park features narrow alleys with quaint old houses that are worth exploring. Teapot Mountain, standing at 599 meters and located east of Jinguashi, offers fantastic views over the town and coastline. It's a strenuous climb to reach the summit rocks due to rough and steep terrain in some places.
name: Jinguashih(Gold Ecological Park)
address: Ruifang District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 224

excerpt: Steep street with sea views from a brightly painted stairway in a residential area built for miners.
detail_description: Qitang Old Street, a residential area constructed for miners, offers a steep street adorned with brightly painted stairways and stunning sea views. This historical place showcases its mining history through attractions such as the Gold Museums exhibits and provides opportunities to refuel with a miners lunchbox. Unlike its popular neighbor, Jiufen's Old Street, Qitang has preserved much of its original charm and remains relatively undeveloped.
name: Qitang Old Street
address: No. 165號, Qitang Rd, Ruifang District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 224

excerpt: Natural rock arch said to resemble the head & trunk of an elephant as it plunges into the sea.
detail_description: Shen’ao Elephant Trunk Rock is a natural rock formation that resembles the head and trunk of an elephant as it extends into the sea. Located near Shen-ao Fishing Harbor, visitors can enjoy local seafood dishes before heading to see this unique geological wonder. The enormous rock has become a hidden gem in Taiwan, attracting tourists with its striking resemblance to an elephant's trunk. While exploring the area, visitors can also check out Keelung Night Market for delicious seafood dishes.
name: Shen’ao Elephant Trunk Rock
address: Ruifang District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 224

excerpt: Compact resort island with unusually shaped coastal rocks, a seawater swimming pool & scenic walks.
detail_description: Peace Island is a compact resort island known for its unusually shaped coastal rocks, seawater swimming pool, and scenic walks. The nearby Miaokou night market in Keelung is a must-visit, as well as the Qingyu Hall with its abandoned 1930s architecture drawing on native Taiwanese and colonial influences. The island is easily accessible from the town center and offers beautiful nature views, a historic bridge, and clean surroundings.
name: Peace Island
address: Zhongzheng District, Keelung City, Taiwan 202

detail_description: Kanziding Fish Market, also known as Bisha Fish Market, is a must-visit for seafood enthusiasts. Located in the fishing port of Keelung, this market offers a unique experience where local fishermen sell their fresh catch daily. The market has a rich history dating back to the Qing dynasty and is considered the oldest outdoor fish market in northern Taiwan. The bustling atmosphere during the busiest period from 3am to 7am allows visitors to witness lively fish auctions.
name: Kanziding Fish Market
address: Xiao 1st Rd, Ren’ai District, Keelung City, Taiwan 200

detail_description: Shifen Station, located on the Pingxi Rail Line in New Taipei City, is a popular destination for releasing sky lanterns. The nearby Shifen Waterfall, just a short walk from the station, is a stunning sight as torrents of water cascade down like a white satin sheet into a deep pool below. Despite its popularity, some visitors are deterred by the one-kilometer walk to the waterfall. Nevertheless, this touristy spot remains an essential visit for many travelers exploring Taiwan and Taipei.
name: Shifen Station
address: Taiwan, New Taipei City, Pingxi District, 226

detail_description: Keelung Station, operated by the Taiwan Railway Administration (TRA), is a key transportation hub in Northern Taiwan. Travelers can catch a local train from Taipei Main Station to Keelung, with departures approximately every 20 minutes. The journey takes around 44 to 51 minutes and offers an affordable ticket fare of about 41 NTD.
name: Keelung
address: No. 5, Gangxi St, Ren’ai District, Keelung City, Taiwan 200

excerpt: Picturesque rock formation along a coral-eroded shore with a striped appearance from oxidation.
detail_description: Nanya Rock is a stunning natural wonder located along the picturesque coral-eroded shores of Ruifang District, just 35 kilometers east of Taipei. This remarkable rock formation boasts a unique striped appearance, created by oxidation over time. The area is renowned for its breathtaking views and serves as an ideal spot to witness mesmerizing sunsets after exploring nearby attractions like Jiufen and Keelung City.
name: Nanya Rock
address: Ruifang District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 224

detail_description: The Jingan Suspension Bridge, built in 1937, is a stunning landmark that greets visitors to the enchanting town of Shifen in Taiwan. As you approach this iconic bridge, you'll be captivated by its breathtaking views of the lush valley and the serene Keelung River below. While many tourists flock to capture that perfect photo at the entrance, crossing the bridge offers a peaceful escape from the crowds.
name: Jingan Suspension Bridge
address: Jing'andiao Bridge, Pingxi District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 226

detail_description: Keelung Mountain is a popular tourist destination near Taipei City, Taiwan. It's located in the mountain town of Jiufen and offers stunning panoramic views of the Pacific Ocean. The trail to the top provides a great seaside view, especially during sunset when dramatic shadows are cast over the hills. The ridge at the top offers a rare clear day panorama over Jiufen and Keelung Mountain.
name: Keelung Mountain
address: Ruifang District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 224

excerpt: Marine science museum in a converted power plant offering interactive activities, a cinema & trails.
detail_description: The National Museum of Marine Science and Technology (NMMST) is situated in the Badouzi peninsula and Wanghaixiang Bay, Keelung city. Housed in a former steam power station from the Japanese Colonial era, this museum offers interactive activities, a cinema, trails, and exhibits focusing on marine life and the fishing industry. The museum area includes the only railway station within a museum in Taiwan. Visitors can enjoy scenic views of Keelung Harbor from the surrounding areas.
name: National Museum of Marine Science and Technology
address: No. 367號, Beining Rd, Zhongzheng District, Keelung City, Taiwan 202

excerpt: Traditional harbor with wooden boats supplying casual fish restaurants, plus bay views & seabirds.
detail_description: Shen'ao Fishing Port is an authentic Taiwanese harbor that offers a unique experience for seafood enthusiasts. The abundance of seafood restaurants in the area reflects the freshness of the daily catches. Visitors can enjoy bay views and observe seabirds while taking in the bustling atmosphere of a working fishing harbor. Additionally, nearby attractions such as Jiufen mountain town, Badouzi railway, and the famous 'Elephant Rock' provide opportunities for exploration and photography.
name: Shen'ao Fishing Port
address: Shenao Rd, Ruifang District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 224

excerpt: Shoreline sightseeing track with kid-friendly 2-person pedal carts painted to look like animals.
detail_description: Shen'ao Rail Bike at Badouzi Station offers a delightful experience for visitors of all ages. The 1.3 km journey takes approximately 30 minutes each way, allowing riders to pedal along a decommissioned railway track from the picturesque Badouzi station by the sea in Keelung to Shenao in New Taipei City.
name: Shen'ao Rail Bike (Badouzi Station)
address: No. 121號, Section 2, Jianji Rd, Ruifang District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 224

excerpt: Roadside viewpoint marked by a pavilion, renowned for its views of the ocean, mountains & sunset.
detail_description: Buyan Pavilion is a popular roadside viewpoint featuring a pavilion that offers stunning vistas of the ocean, mountains, and sunset. It's recommended to start the hike from QinXian junior high school for an opportunity to encounter diverse wildlife and remnants of miners' dwellings along the trail. This tranquil spot is perfect for a relaxing weekend getaway, especially in the evening when you can enjoy expansive views of Yangmingshan range and Keelung port.
name: Buyan Pavilion
address: Ruishuang Rd, Shuangxi District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 227

excerpt: Relics of a shrine built in 1898 & reached by stone steps for views of former mining town Jinguashi.
detail_description: Jinguashi Shrine, also known as Ogon Shrine or Gold Temple, is a historic Shinto shrine located halfway up a mountain in the Gold Ecological Park in Jinguashi, Taiwan. Built in 1898 during the Japanese occupation period, it offers stunning views of the former mining town and the beautiful ocean on sunny days. The shrine can be reached by climbing stone steps for about 30 minutes, with well-maintained stairs of moderate difficulty.
name: Jinguashi Shrine
address: 黃金博物館, No. 8, Jinguang Rd, Ruifang District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 224

excerpt: Bright rooms, some with soaking tubs, in a relaxed hotel offering a casual bar/lounge & free Wi-Fi.
name: Just Live Inn
address: No. 156號, Xinyi Rd, Zhongzheng District, Keelung City, Taiwan 202

detail_description: When visiting New Taipei City, consider exploring the Sandiaoling Waterfalls Observation Deck for a serene alternative to the bustling Shifen area. This hidden gem offers a tranquil hiking experience with the opportunity to witness three distinct waterfalls amidst picturesque mountain scenery. For those interested in swimming, there are various options available, and it's recommended to refer to local blogs for guidance on selecting the ideal waterfall based on your schedule.
name: Sandiaoling Waterfalls Observation Deck
address: Ruifang District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 224

detail_description: Keelung, a northern port city located about 25 km southwest of Taipei in Taiwan, is known for its delicious seafood. The city is situated on the coast and offers an abundance of fresh seafood from the nearby port and ocean. Miaokou market is a must-visit destination for food enthusiasts, offering a wide variety of delectable dishes. With an emphasis on seafood, visitors can indulge in the local culinary delights while exploring this vibrant coastal city.
name: Keelung
address: Ren’ai District, Keelung City, Taiwan

excerpt: Scenic walking route along ocean cliffs, featuring a lighthouse, stairs & lookout pavilions.
detail_description: Bitoujiao Trail is a picturesque walking route along ocean cliffs, offering stunning views of the northern coast. The 3.5-kilometer trail loops from a small fishing village over the headland of Bitoujiao, featuring a lighthouse, stairs, and lookout pavilions. The popularity of this trail has soared due to its Instagram-worthy photo opportunities. Visitors can enjoy the beautiful ocean and mountain views during the approximately one-hour hike.
name: Bitoujiao Trail
address: Bitou Rd, Ruifang District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 224

excerpt: Abandoned former smelter plant & mining facility with multiple tiers running along a hillside.
detail_description: Water Nan Dong Xuan Smelter Plant Ruins is a historical site located in Taiwan, known for its abandoned former smelter plant and mining facility. Built in 1933, it was used as an ore sorting and smelting plant for the Taiwan Metals Mining Corp. The ruins consist of multiple tiers running along a hillside, with a total of 13 levels, earning it the local nickname "13 stories.
name: 水湳洞選煉廠遺址
address: Ruifang District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 224

detail_description: The Coal Museum is a museum in the middle of town with exhibits on the history of coal mining in China. It's well organized, with a village filled with miners' homes and other artifacts from the industry. Mosquitoes can be a bit of a nuisance at the riverbank area, so make sure to bring repellants and/or a light jacket.
name: Houtong Coal Mine Ecological Park
address: No. 42, Chailiao Rd, Ruifang District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 224

excerpt: Picturesque cliffside park with ocean cliffs & walking paths alongside a lighthouse & lookout stops.
detail_description: Bitou Cape Park is a stunning cliffside park located at the northernmost part of Taiwan, offering picturesque ocean views and walking paths alongside a lighthouse and lookout stops. The trail provides breathtaking views of nearby attractions such as Jiufen, Jinguashi Gold Museum, Keeluang Mountain, Yinyang Sea, Yehliu Geopark, and Keelung Islet.
name: Bitou Cape Park
address: No. 1, Bitou Rd, Ruifang District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 224

detail_description: Nestled in the captivating Ruifang district, the Shuinandong Tourist Center serves as a gateway to an area rich in history and natural beauty. Visitors can explore the remnants of a once-thriving mining operation, featuring abandoned structures, funiculars, tunnels, and towering smokestacks that tell tales of yesteryears. Just a short distance away lies the stunning Golden Waterfalls, where water cascades down like liquid gold—a sight not to be missed!
name: Shuinandong Tourist Center
address: No. 155-8, Dongding Rd, Ruifang District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 224

detail_description: The Dajianshan Trail is a relatively simple hiking route with occasional challenging sections due to the presence of numerous stairs. At the trailhead, there is a convenient water station where hikers can refill their bottles, which is essential for staying hydrated during the hike. Upon reaching the mountain's summit, visitors are rewarded with breathtaking panoramic views of Xizhi, Taipei 101, Keelung, and Ruifang.
name: Dajianshan Trail
address: Qinjin Rd, Xizhi District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 221

detail_description: Jiufen Xiahai City God temple is a must-visit spot in Jiufen, offering beautiful carvings and a serene atmosphere for making wishes related to wealth, career, and health. As one of the main temples in the area, it serves to protect the locals. The temple's stunning architecture and nighttime illumination make it an enchanting sight. Visitors can also enjoy picturesque views from this tourist hotspot.
name: Jiufen Xiahai City God temple
address: No. 11, Qiche Rd, Ruifang District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 224

detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Keelung, Xiandongyan Zuisheng Temple is a captivating natural cave that offers visitors a unique blend of spirituality and nature. Originally established during World War II as a shrine, it has evolved into an impressive temple adorned with intricate Buddha carvings along its walls. The ambiance inside is both serene and otherworldly, making it an ideal spot for reflection or simply soaking in the magical power of nature.
name: Xiandongyan Zuisheng Temple
address: No. 1, Renan St, Zhongshan District, Keelung City, Taiwan 20343

detail_description: The tranquil and refined Ruifang Park is connected to the suburban mountain trails of Ruifang. Even on holidays, it remains sparsely populated, offering a serene atmosphere for visitors. The well-equipped hiking trails provide an excellent opportunity to explore the breathtaking beauty of the surrounding mountains and seas. A visit to this park is highly recommended for those seeking solace in nature. In addition, Ruifang Park boasts modern and secure facilities that make it particularly popular among families with children.
name: Ruifang Park
address: Ruifang District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 224

excerpt: Ornate hillside temple known for a huge bronze statue of the deity Guanyu & 2 carved stone pillars.
name: Chuen Ji Hall
address: No. 53號, Qitang Rd, Ruifang District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 224

excerpt: Popular short trail with steps to a hilltop offering views of the coastline & nearby peaks.
detail_description: Nanzilin Trail is a hidden gem in the northeast shore of Taiwan, offering a fairly easy hike with breathtaking views. The trail, less than 1 km long, features wooden and rocky stairs leading to the hilltop where hikers can enjoy a 360-degree panoramic view of mountains and the Pacific Ocean. Embraced by greenery, this trail provides limited visitors during weekdays and takes about 40 minutes to reach the top.
name: Nanzilin Trail
address: Ruifang District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 224

excerpt: Modest rooms, some with sitting areas, in a casual B&B offering sea & mountain views.
detail_description: The Jiufen Kite Museum is a bed and breakfast with some rooms with sitting areas that offers sea and mountain views. The staff are friendly and the rooms are comfortable.
name: Jiufen Kite Museum
address: No. 20號坑尾巷 Ruifang District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 224

excerpt: Hiking trail with cable bridges & steep stone steps, passing a railroad line & small waterfalls.
detail_description: Sandiaoling Trail is a popular day hike in northern Taiwan, known for its cable bridges, steep stone steps, and small waterfalls. To access the trail, visitors can get off at Sandiaoling Station and follow the tracks before crossing to the opposite side and finding Cafe Hyatt. The trail offers a shaded walk by a stream and an adventurous experience.
name: Sandiaoling Trail
address: Ruifang District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 224

detail_description: The Shancheng Art Gallery Performance and Exhibition Gallery, located nearby, offers a cultural tour where visitors can learn the process of making tofu. It is an art space situated in a picturesque area and boasts dedicated staff and volunteers who enthusiastically share stories about the community and provide insights into the displayed artifacts and products. The gallery's small size may be underwhelming for some, but its function room facility is noteworthy. Additionally, guests can enjoy breathtaking mountain views while having coffee or lunch at the on-site restaurant.
name: Shancheng Art Gallery Performance and Exhibition Gallery
address: 之2, No. 117號, Qingbian Rd, Ruifang District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 224

excerpt: Scenic locale with ocean & cliff views & a white cylinder lighthouse built in 1971 after WWII.
detail_description: Bitoujiao Lighthouse, a charming white cylindrical structure built in 1971, stands proudly on the cliffs offering breathtaking views of the ocean. Nestled amidst scenic trails that are well-maintained, this spot is perfect for those looking to enjoy nature's beauty. Starting your hike from Bitou Elementary School provides a more comfortable route, although access to the lighthouse itself is restricted due to military protection. The journey typically takes about 1.
name: Bitoujiao Lighthouse
address: No. 99, Bitou Rd, Ruifang District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 224

detail_description: Dacukeng Historic Trail, once a prosperous village fueled by coal profits, now stands abandoned and inhabited only by stray dogs. The trail offers a glimpse into the remnants of this community as you climb the stairs. The journey continues to Jiufen for some well-deserved snacks. The trail is known for its beautiful mountain scenery and takes about 3 hours at a leisurely pace, offering stunning views of Jiufen on clear days.
name: Dacukeng Historic Trail
address: Ruifang District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 224

detail_description: Embark on an adventure along the Diaoshan Historic Trail, a scenic route that descends into the picturesque valley beneath Mt. Caiguangliao, the region's tallest peak at 738 meters. This well-maintained trail offers a delightful hiking experience, and for those looking to avoid retracing their steps, a leisurely 2-kilometer walk along the road leads to Mudan Railway Station.
name: Diaoshan Historic Trail
address: Unnamed Rd,, Ruifang District, New Taipei City, Taiwan 224
